title.narrative: 2. PUBLIC FINANCE FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: BY 2022, the departments of the ministries in charge of finance and social sectors are better equipped with capacity to mobilize and manage resources efficiently, and plan and budget based on women's and children's priority needs., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Children With Disabilities, Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Evaluation, Reducing Child Poverty, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: by 2022, Children (girls/boys) and women, especially the most disadvantaged, have better access to social protection programmes and the state budget allocation to exercise their rights.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: BY 2022, the departments of the ministries in charge of finance and social sectors are better equipped with capacity to mobilizeand manage resources efficiently, and plan and budget based on women?s and children?s priority needs.

description.narrative: UNICEF strengthened policy dialogue and advocacy towards the Government to improve the child-sensitiveness of public budgeting by supporting public expenditure tracking surveys and a public expenditure reviews in the areas of health, education, child protection and social protection. The completion of the Demographic and Health Survey data collection will provide updated key indicators on the situation of children and women by 2022. | Status:Met | As-of Date:29/01/2022
